Inferring a trajectory inference using SCORPIUS sparse

Source: R/ti_scorpius.R, R/ti_container.R
ti_scorpius_sparse.Rd

Will generate a trajectory using SCORPIUS sparse. This method was wrapped inside a container.

ti_scorpius_sparse(docker = dynwrap::test_docker_installation(),
  distance_method = "spearman", ndim = 3, k = 4, thresh = 0.001,
  maxit = 10, stretch = 0, smoother = "smooth_spline", sparse = TRUE)

ti_scorpius_sparse(docker = dynwrap::test_docker_installation(),
  distance_method = "spearman", ndim = 3, k = 4, thresh = 0.001,
  maxit = 10, stretch = 0, smoother = "smooth_spline", sparse = TRUE)

Arguments

docker

Whether to use the docker container or the R wrapper
distance_method

A character string indicating which correlation coefficient (or covariance) is to be computed. One of "pearson", "kendall", or "spearman".
ndim

The number of dimensions in the new space.
k

The number of clusters to cluster the data into.
thresh

principal.curve parameter: convergence threshhold on shortest distances to the curve
maxit

principal.curve parameter: maximum number of iterations
stretch

principal.curve parameter: a factor by which the curve can be extrapolated when points are projected
smoother

principal.curve parameter: choice of smoother
sparse

Whether or not to use sparse MDS dimensionality reduction, for datasets with large amounts of cells.

Value

The trajectory model

Details

This methods was first wrapped inside R, see ti_scorpius_sparse

The original code of this method is available here.

The method is described in: Cannoodt, R., Saelens, W., Sichien, D., Tavernier, S., Janssens, S., Guilliams, M., Lambrecht, B.N., De Preter, K., Saeys, Y., 2016. SCORPIUS improves trajectory inference and identifies novel modules in dendritic cell development.

Developed by Robrecht Cannoodt, Wouter Saelens.
